messages.message:
For a Demo, S&P have provided these questions

> What are S&P’s core business divisions as of the period ending March 31, 2023 and how are they described?
> What are the revenues for each division the period ending Q1 2023 and 2022 respectively?
> What was S&P’s total operating profit in Q1 2022? What was S&P’s total operating profit in Q1 2021? What is the difference between the two?
> What was Market Intelligence’s subscription revenue for the period ending March 31, 2023?
> What was S&P’s Earnings per share for the periods ending March 31, 2022 and March 31,v2023
> When was Chart IQ acquired? What is Chart IQ?
> What acquisition was completed on January 4, 2023?
> When did S&P complete its Merger with IHS Markit? What was the value of the transaction?
> When in 2023 did S&P’s Board of Directors approve an increase in its dividend? What is the quarterly common stock dividend amount? How does this compare with the same period in 2022?
> What is the difference in value on S&P’s net income between Q1 2023 and the same period in 2021?
> What was S&P’s people strategy as of the period ending March 31, 2022?
> What accounting guidance did the Financial Accounting Standards Board issue on March 2023?
Across these docs (attached)

Right now I have to try a Q against each doc and sometimes it says "can't be found" other times it finds it. So i have to trial-and-error to find which doc the answer is within.
@Hari @Rafal let’s add these to our benchmark dataset for multi docs

Very similar to Weaver I spoke with someone that works closely in credit analysis. They shared their use case of wanting to review the past 4 years of annual reports. They wanted to understand the trend across those 4 annual reports. Things like:

prompt: in a table with fiscal year end as columns show me the following rows: actual revenue, forecasted revenue, percent deviation of actual to forecast

Then when there’s meaningful deviation follow up questions like:

prompt: In FY21 revenue fell short of the target, what are managements reasons explaining why they missed their goal

I’ve tried similar queries on a single doc, and they’ve worked well. It would be a super power to be able to ask questions like these across documents.
